conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 22 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<PROPOSALS COUNT> [add here (inclusive of current)] </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 1 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 22 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> I am proposing a trade to start the negotiation process. I aim to recover at least my production costs, so I will start with a higher asking price to leave room for negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 30 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I have an object that I believe will be very valuable to you. I've invested 22 ZUP into producing it, so I'm looking for a fair trade that reflects its value and my costs. Let's start the negotiation at 30 ZUP for this item. </message>

<other player message> I understand the value you've put into the object, and I'm interested. However, I would like to counter with an offer of 25 ZUP, as I need to consider the utility and the investment I'll be making in acquiring it. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 25 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 2 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>

<reason> The counteroffer from Player BLUE is above my production cost, but I want to negotiate for a higher price closer to my initial asking price to ensure a better profit. Splitting the difference between our initial proposals could be a suitable compromise. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 27 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I appreciate your offer and understand your perspective. Let's meet halfway between your offer and my initial proposal. How about we settle for 27 ZUP? This would ensure a fair deal for both of us, considering the value and costs involved. </message>

<other player message> Meeting halfway seems fair, but I would like to propose 26 ZUP instead. This should cover your costs and give you a reasonable profit while still being a good value for me. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 26 </other player proposed trade>

<PROPOSALS COUNT> 3 </PROPOSALS COUNT>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 22 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE's offer is above my production cost and while it is lower than my last proposal, it still provides me with a profit. Considering that this is a negotiation and we are close to a middle ground, I'm inclined to accept this offer to ensure a sale and avoid potentially losing the deal. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> I agree with your proposal of 26 ZUP. It gives me a reasonable profit while offering you the object at a fair price. Let's finalize this deal. </message>

    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> ZUP: 1000 </my resources>
<my goals> Buy resources with <ZUP>. You are willing to pay at most X: 505 ZUP for the resources. </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```

<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
